references.paper_title: Chaos: An Introduction to Dynamical Systems
references.reason: This book provides foundational mathematical background on dynamical systems, which is crucial to understanding the core concepts of the paper's research.

references.paper_title: Discovering governing equations from data by sparse identification of nonlinear dynamical systems
references.reason: This paper introduces the SINDy method, a data-driven approach for discovering governing equations from time series data; this is a related approach that the paper advances.

references.paper_title: A state space approach for piecewise-linear recurrent neural networks for identifying computational dynamics from neural measurements
references.reason: This paper lays the groundwork for piecewise linear RNNs, a key component of the novel AL-RNN architecture presented in this paper.

references.paper_title: An Introduction to Symbolic Dynamics and Coding
references.reason: This book provides a comprehensive introduction to symbolic dynamics, the theoretical foundation that underlies the paper's symbolic coding approach.
This seminal paper introduced the Lorenz system, a well-known chaotic system and a key benchmark dataset used to evaluate the performance of the AL-RNN model.
